intro: Annesorhiza hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy bulblet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered, small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, round bulblets that are often used for propagation. Annesorhiza hirsuta thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
